remarks: The indexed union of a function's values is the union of its image under the index class.  This version of ~ funiunfv uses a bound-variable hypothesis in place of a distinct variable condition.  (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2006.)  (Revised by David Abernethy, 15-Apr-2013.)
statement:
funiunfvf.1 $e |- F/_ x F $.
funiunfvf $p |- ( Fun F -> U_ x e. A ( F ` x ) = U. ( F " A ) ) $.
$d A x $.
